faculty_name: SCHOOL OF LEADERSHIP, GOVERNANCE AND SECURITY
note: This school focuses on developing strategic leaders for public, private and security-related sectors.
Programmes are affiliated with the University of Cape Coast and designed as intensive professional graduate pathways.

courses.course_name: Level 8 Diploma in Strategic Management & Leadership Practice

fees: Ghanaian Students: GHC 7,500 per semester (indicative, similar to Marshalls MSc fees)
mode: Evening and weekend delivery for working executives
entry_requirements: Master's degree or Level 7 postgraduate diploma in a related field
OR Bachelor’s degree with substantial senior management experience
Successful performance at selection interview
level_note: Designed as a Level 8 professional qualification aligned with strategic executive roles.
Emphasizes practical application of strategy, leadership and governance in complex organisations.

courses.course_name: PhD in Strategic Leadership & Governance (Coming Soon)
career: University Professor of Leadership and Governance

fees: To be announced by Marshalls University College
electives: Doctoral Thesis in Strategic Leadership and Governance
entry_requirements: Relevant Master’s degree (e.g., MSc in Strategic Leadership and Governance or related field)
Strong academic record and research proposal
Successful performance at selection interview
level_note: Planned terminal degree in leadership and governance for scholar-practitioners.
Aims to produce thought leaders who can shape governance and strategic leadership practice in Africa and beyond.

courses.course_name: Master of Science in Strategic Leadership and Governance

fees: Ghanaian Students: GHC 7,500 per semester (12‑month MSc leadership fees publicised by Marshalls)
electives: Research Methods in Leadership and Governance
mode: Evening and weekend classes for working professionals
entry_requirements: Bachelor’s degree with at least Second Class Lower from a recognised university
Relevant work experience in public, private or civil society sectors preferred
Successful selection interview
level_note: Targets middle and senior level leaders who need strategic leadership and governance capabilities.[web:7][web:13]
Affiliated with the University of Cape Coast and tailored to African governance and organisational realities.[web:8][web:7]

courses.course_name: Master of Science in Educational Leadership and Governance

fees: Ghanaian Students: GHC 7,500 per semester (indicative, aligned to other Marshalls MSc leadership programmes)
mode: Designed for practising educators and administrators
Blends theory, policy and practice in education leadership
entry_requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Education or related field with at least Second Class Lower
Significant experience in teaching or educational administration preferred
Selection interview
level_note: Develops competent, well‑rounded education leaders in strategic leadership and governance.[web:10]
Addresses governance, accountability and strategic change in schools, colleges and universities.

courses.course_name: Postgraduate Diploma in Strategic Intelligence & National Security (Coming Soon)

fees: To be announced by Marshalls University College
electives: Risk Assessment and Early Warning Systems
mode: Evening and weekend classes for security professionals
entry_requirements: Bachelor’s degree from a recognised institution
Background in security, military, police, immigration, or related fields preferred
Security clearance and/or institutional recommendation may be required
level_note: Planned programme to strengthen national security and intelligence capacity.
Targets officers and analysts seeking formal training in strategic intelligence and security leadership.

name: Marshalls University College
note: This school offers market‑oriented undergraduate degrees in business and hospitality.
Programmes are practice‑oriented and aligned with industry needs in Ghana and beyond.[web:2]

courses.course_name: B.Sc. Human Resource Management

fees: Ghanaian Students: approx. GHC 15,000 per year (based on typical Marshalls business tuition converted from published USD ranges)
mode: Blended lectures, case studies and group projects
entry_requirements: WASSCE: Credit passes (A1‑C6) in English, Core Mathematics and Integrated Science/Social Studies
Credit passes in three relevant elective subjects
Mature applicants considered per GTEC guidelines
level_note: Prepares graduates for professional HR roles in corporate, public and NGO sectors.
Curriculum covers both operational and strategic aspects of people management.

courses.course_name: B.Sc. Marketing

fees: Ghanaian Students: approx. GHC 15,000 per year
mode: Full‑time with strong practical marketing projects
Internships with marketing and advertising firms
entry_requirements: WASSCE: Credit passes in three core subjects including English and Mathematics
Credit passes in three elective subjects
Mature applicants with marketing/sales experience considered
level_note: Equips students with up‑to‑date marketing and digital skills for competitive markets.
Emphasis on creativity, market research and data‑driven decision‑making.

courses.course_name: B.Sc. Hospitality Management

fees: Ghanaian Students: approx. GHC 15,000 per year
mode: Industrial attachment in hotels and resorts
entry_requirements: WASSCE: Credit passes in English, Mathematics and Integrated Science
Credit passes in three electives (e.g. Home Economics, Business, General Arts)
Mature applicants with hospitality experience considered
level_note: Targets Ghana’s growing hospitality and tourism industry.
Develops operational and service excellence skills for hospitality management roles.

courses.course_name: Advanced Diploma in Fashion Technology

fees: Ghanaian Students: approx. GHC 10,000 - 12,000 per year
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE passes in at least five subjects
Interest or prior experience in fashion or design strongly preferred
Portfolio or practical assessment may be required
level_note: Hands‑on programme for creative students aspiring to enter the fashion industry.
Strong focus on both design creativity and production/entrepreneurship.

name: Marshalls University College
note: Marshalls is an approved OTHM Qualifications UK centre offering Ofqual‑regulated diplomas from Level 4 to Level 7.[web:8][web:22]
These professional diplomas provide international progression routes to top‑up degrees and Master’s programmes in the UK and elsewhere.

courses.course_name: Level 4 Diploma in Business Management

entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE or equivalent with passes in five subjects including English
Mature learners with relevant experience considered
level_note: Equivalent to the first year of a UK honours degree.
Provides a foundation in core business and management concepts.

courses.course_name: Level 5 Diploma in Business Management

mode: Progression from OTHM Level 4 or equivalent
entry_requirements: OTHM Level 4 Diploma in Business Management or equivalent
Alternative Level 4 qualification with relevant experience
level_note: Equivalent to the second year of a UK honours degree.
Builds management, leadership and functional business knowledge.

courses.course_name: Level 6 Diploma in Business Management

mode: Top‑up route to final‑year honours degree overseas
entry_requirements: OTHM Level 5 Diploma in Business Management or equivalent
Higher National Diploma or similar with experience
level_note: Equivalent to the final year of a UK honours degree.
Prepares learners for senior supervisory and management roles.

courses.course_name: Level 7 Diploma in Accounting and Finance

mode: Postgraduate‑level diploma equivalent to UK Master’s level
Evening and weekend suitable for professionals
entry_requirements: Accounting/Finance degree or Level 6 equivalent
Alternatively, other degree plus relevant professional experience
level_note: Provides advanced accounting and finance expertise with progression to MSc top‑up programmes.
Suitable for those seeking senior finance leadership roles.

courses.course_name: Level 4 Diploma in Education and Training Management

mode: Flexible study for aspiring educators and trainers
entry_requirements: Secondary school qualification (WASSCE/SSSCE) or equivalent
Interest in education, training or facilitation
level_note: Introduces principles of education, training and basic management of learning.
Suitable for entry into education support and training roles.

courses.course_name: Level 5 Diploma in Education and Training

mode: Combination of practice‑based and theoretical modules
entry_requirements: Level 4 qualification in education/training or related area
Alternatively, teaching/training experience plus secondary qualification
level_note: Strengthens practical teaching, training and assessment skills.
Supports roles in TVET, adult learning, corporate training and NGOs.

courses.course_name: Level 6 Diploma in Teaching and Learning

mode: May provide progression to education‑related Master’s
entry_requirements: Level 5 qualification in education/training or teaching experience with degree/HND
Evidence of teaching practice
level_note: Focuses on advanced teaching, curriculum and educational leadership skills.
Suitable for those seeking senior responsibilities in education and training.

courses.course_name: Level 7 Diploma in Education Management and Leadership

electives: Finance and Resource Management in Education
entry_requirements: Bachelor’s degree and teaching/education management experience
OR Level 6 qualification in a related field with experience
level_note: Prepares senior leaders for strategic roles in schools, colleges, universities and education NGOs.
Can lead to top‑up Master’s in education leadership.

courses.course_name: Level 4 Diploma in Health and Social Care Management

electives: Communication in Health and Social Care
Health and Safety in Care Settings
Sociology for Health and Social Care
mode: Suitable for those entering health and social care roles
entry_requirements: Secondary school qualification (WASSCE/SSSCE) or equivalent
Interest in health or social care work
level_note: Introduces key concepts, values and skills for health and social care settings.
Supports progression into further study or entry‑level roles in care organisations.

courses.course_name: Level 6 Diploma in Health and Social Care Management
career: Quality and Compliance Officer (Health and Social Care)

electives: Managing Quality in Health and Social Care
Leadership and Management in Health and Social Care
Research Methods in Health and Social Care
Strategic Planning in Health and Social Care
entry_requirements: Level 5 qualification in health/social care or related field
Relevant supervisory/management experience in care settings
level_note: Develops leadership and management capability in health and social care organisations.
Supports career progression into senior supervisory roles and further postgraduate study.

courses.course_name: Level 6 Diploma in Occupational Health and Safety

electives: Health and Safety Management Principles and Policy
Health and Safety Legislation and Regulation
Developing a Positive Health and Safety Culture
mode: Designed for OHS practitioners and managers
Can lead to professional body recognition depending on pathway
entry_requirements: Level 5 qualification in OHS or related field
Alternatively, significant OHS experience plus relevant academic background
level_note: Equips learners to manage health and safety risks in complex workplaces.
Relevant across construction, manufacturing, oil and gas, and public sector organisations.

courses.course_name: Level 4 Diploma in Logistics and Supply Chain Management

electives: Business Environment for Logistics and Supply Chain
mode: Foundation in logistics and supply chain concepts
entry_requirements: Secondary school qualification (WASSCE/SSSCE) or equivalent
Interest in logistics, warehousing or procurement
level_note: Introduces key logistics and supply chain functions and processes.
Suited for entry‑level roles in logistics, warehousing and distribution.

courses.course_name: Level 5 Diploma in Logistics and Supply Chain Management

mode: Balanced theory and applied logistics practice
entry_requirements: Level 4 qualification in logistics/supply chain or related area
Relevant logistics/operations experience plus secondary qualification
level_note: Deepens operational logistics and supply chain competencies.
Supports supervisory roles and further progression to Level 6.

courses.course_name: Level 5 Diploma in Information Technology

mode: Progression from Level 4 or equivalent IT qualifications
Can lead to BSc top‑up overseas
entry_requirements: Level 4 qualification in IT or related subject
Alternatively, strong practical IT background plus academic credentials
level_note: Builds solid intermediate‑level IT skills across software, networks and databases.
Suitable for IT support and junior admin/developer roles.

courses.course_name: Level 6 Diploma in Information Technology

mode: Advanced IT modules with project‑based assessment
Progression to BSc (Hons) top‑up or Master’s pathway
entry_requirements: Level 5 diploma in IT or related field
Appropriate work experience plus Level 5/degree may also be accepted
level_note: Develops advanced technical and strategic IT capabilities.
Positions graduates for higher‑level technical roles and further academic progression.

courses.course_name: Level 6 Diploma in Accounting and Business

mode: Accounting and business‑focused diploma equivalent to degree level
entry_requirements: Level 5 diploma in business/accounting or related area
Alternative qualifications with relevant experience
level_note: Provides upper‑undergraduate level preparation in accounting and business.
Supports progression to professional bodies and degree top‑ups.

courses.course_name: Level 6 Diploma in Tourism and Hospitality Management

mode: Advanced‑level programme for tourism and hospitality supervisors and managers
entry_requirements: Level 5 diploma in tourism/hospitality or business
Work experience in tourism/hospitality advantageous
level_note: Aligns with managerial roles in hotels, resorts, tour companies and destination organisations.
Emphasises sustainability and strategic management in tourism and hospitality.
